category.text: $course$/Experiencing MIS, 9e (Kroenke)/019 Chapter Extension 7 Using Microsoft Access 2019

name.text: q001 Before using a database management system (DBMS), a user should create a(n)

questiontext.text: Before using a database management system (DBMS), a user should create a(n) ________.

name.text: q002 Which of the following is the first activity to be performed while creating

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the first activity to be performed while creating a database using Microsoft Access?

name.text: q003 Which of the following statements is TRUE of naming a new database in Micro

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of naming a new database in Microsoft Access?

answer.text: A user must type the name of the new database in the blank provided under File Name.
A user must select the name of his new database from the drop-down list provided next to the File Name.
Microsoft Access opens the new database with the default name, database 1.
Microsoft Access requires a user to name the new database before selecting a Blank desktop database.

name.text: q004 Microsoft Access opens a new database by creating a ________.

questiontext.text: Microsoft Access opens a new database by creating a ________.

answer.text: new Word document in the cloud
shared storage space in the server

name.text: q005 In Microsoft Access, different attributes are referred to as ________.

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, different attributes are referred to as ________.

name.text: q006 In Microsoft Access, the description of fields is used to ________.

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, the description of fields is used to ________.

answer.text: document the details of each field
define rules for how each field should behave
define how the fields should behave in case of exceptions
specify the data types of the fields

name.text: q007 Which of the following is a valid entry for field size if the data type of

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a valid entry for field size if the data type of the field is Number?

name.text: q008 Which of the following statements is TRUE about a primary key in Microsoft

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about a primary key in Microsoft Access?

answer.text: Only one field in a table can be marked as the primary key.
The attribute which is italicized is the primary key.
A primary key should have its Required Field property set to No.
A foreign key can be used as one of the fields for a primary key.

name.text: q009 Before using any database management system (DBMS), a user should create a

questiontext.text: Before using any database management system (DBMS), a user should create a data model based on users' requirements.

name.text: q010 In Microsoft Access, an underlined attribute is a primary key and an italic

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, an underlined attribute is a primary key and an italicized attribute is a foreign key.

name.text: q011 Microsoft Access opens a new database by creating a default table named Tab

questiontext.text: Microsoft Access opens a new database by creating a default table named Table A.

name.text: q012 In Microsoft Access, one must select the relationships option in the Design

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, one must select the relationships option in the Design tab to modify the design of a default table.

name.text: q013 Every field in Microsoft Access must have a Description associated with it.

questiontext.text: Every field in Microsoft Access must have a Description associated with it.

name.text: q014 The Description field in Microsoft Access is used mainly for documentation.

questiontext.text: The Description field in Microsoft Access is used mainly for documentation.

name.text: q015 Any text entered as the Description of a field is displayed as help text on

questiontext.text: Any text entered as the Description of a field is displayed as help text on forms.

name.text: q016 In Microsoft Access, "Integer" is a valid entry for Field Size if the Data

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, "Integer" is a valid entry for Field Size if the Data Type is "Text."

name.text: q017 What steps must a database designer take before creating a database with Mi

questiontext.text: What steps must a database designer take before creating a database with Microsoft Access?

graderinfo.text: A designer needs to first create a data model from a list of the users' requirements. Then, the data model must be transformed into a database design. Only at this point should tables be created in a database management system (DBMS).

name.text: q018 Explain the procedure for creating a new database using Microsoft Access.

questiontext.text: Explain the procedure for creating a new database using Microsoft Access.

graderinfo.text: To create a new database, select Blank desktop database from the templates displayed in the center of the opening screen. Then, type the name of the new database under File Name. Microsoft Access will suggest a directory; change it if another one should be used, and then click Create. Microsoft Access opens the new database by creating a default table named Table.

name.text: q019 Relationships can be defined in Microsoft Access by selecting the ________

questiontext.text: Relationships can be defined in Microsoft Access by selecting the ________ tab in the ribbon.

name.text: q020 In Microsoft Access, to create a relationship between one row of a table an

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, to create a relationship between one row of a table and an unlimited number of rows in another table, users should ________.

answer.text: drag the primary key in one table to the foreign key in another table
create a link between the foreign keys of both the tables
drag the foreign key in one table to the primary key in another table
create a link between the primary key in one table to the primary key in another table

name.text: q021 Russell works on two tables in Microsoft Access. One is for contractual emp

questiontext.text: Russell works on two tables in Microsoft Access. One is for contractual employees, whereas, the other is for permanent employees. He creates a relationship between the two tables. Which of the following steps should Russell take next?

name.text: q022 In Microsoft Access, after creating a relationship between two tables, the

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, after creating a relationship between two tables, the user cannot and need not assign values for the ________.

name.text: q023 In Microsoft Access, a user has to define the relationship between two tabl

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, a user has to define the relationship between two tables before creating them.

name.text: q024 In Microsoft Access, relationships can be defined by selecting the Database

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, relationships can be defined by selecting the Database Tools tab.

name.text: q025 To create a relationship between one row of a table and an unlimited number

questiontext.text: To create a relationship between one row of a table and an unlimited number of rows in another table using Microsoft Access, users must drag the foreign key in one table to the primary key in another table.

name.text: q026 To delete data in Microsoft Access, a user should double-click the table na

questiontext.text: To delete data in Microsoft Access, a user should double-click the table name in the left-hand pane.

name.text: q027 Explain the procedure for establishing a relationship between two tables in

questiontext.text: Explain the procedure for establishing a relationship between two tables in Microsoft Access.

graderinfo.text:
After creating tables in Microsoft Access, the next step is to define relationships. This can be done by clicking the Database Tools tab in the ribbon and then clicking the Relationships icon near the left-hand side of that ribbon. The Relationships window will open and the Show Table dialog box will be displayed. Double-clicking on table names will add those tables to the Relationships window. Close the Show Table dialog box.
To create a relationship between one row of the first table and an unlimited number of rows in the second table, click on the primary key attribute in the first table and drag that attribute on top of the foreign key in the second table. In the dialog box, click Enforce Referential Integrity, then Cascade Update Related Fields, and then Cascade Delete Related Records. Close the Relationships window and save the changes when requested to do so. The database now has two tables and a relationship.

name.text: q028 Which of the following is one of the alternatives for creating a data entry

questiontext.text: Which of the following is one of the alternatives for creating a data entry form in Microsoft Access?

name.text: q029 Ramona works for City Hospital. She wants to fill in details of the hospita

questiontext.text: Ramona works for City Hospital. She wants to fill in details of the hospital staff into the database, but she does not want to use the default table display. She prefers a design that would be easier to use and view. Which of the following options would suit Ramona's requirements?

name.text: q030 Jane is performing a monthly check on her company's database. She finds rec

questiontext.text: Jane is performing a monthly check on her company's database. She finds records of a number of employees who are no longer working with the company and whose details need to be deleted. To delete the records, Jane would have to select the Records section in the ________ tab.

name.text: q031 Microsoft Access provides a default table display for creating a data entry

questiontext.text: Microsoft Access provides a default table display for creating a data entry form.

name.text: q032 In Microsoft Access, the option to generate a data entry form is present in

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, the option to generate a data entry form is present in the Create ribbon.

name.text: q033 In Microsoft Access, a surrogate key has no meaning to the user.

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, a surrogate key has no meaning to the user.

name.text: q034 Explain the different alternatives provided by Microsoft Access for creatin

questiontext.text: Explain the different alternatives provided by Microsoft Access for creating data entry forms.

graderinfo.text: Microsoft Access provides several alternatives for creating a data entry form. The first is to use the default table display. The default table display provided by Microsoft Access can be used to enter the required data. This data entry display, although convenient, is limited in its capability. It also does not provide a very pleasing user interface. For more generality and better design, users can use the Microsoft Access form generator. The form generator can generate a data entry form that is more pleasing to view and easier to use than the default table. To use this form, first click the Create tab to open the Create ribbon. Next, click the table for which they want to enter data. Finally, click Form. Microsoft Access uses metadata about the tables and their relationship to create the data entry form.

name.text: q035 All relational database management system (DBMS) products can process the _

questiontext.text: All relational database management system (DBMS) products can process the ________ query language.

name.text: q036 Which of the following statements is TRUE about queries in Microsoft Access

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about queries in Microsoft Access?

answer.text: Only rows with value matches in all tables are shown by default if more than one table is selected.
Only rows having 'Number' data type can be used to arrange the results of a query in ascending order.
Queries can include fields from only one table.
The query design option is present in the Database Tools tab.

name.text: q037 Microsoft Access can process SQL.

questiontext.text: Microsoft Access can process SQL.

name.text: q038 Though Microsoft Access can be used to create and process queries, it does

questiontext.text: Though Microsoft Access can be used to create and process queries, it does not provide a graphical interface for the queries.

name.text: q039 To create a query in Microsoft Access, one must drag columns out of the req

questiontext.text: To create a query in Microsoft Access, one must drag columns out of the required tables into the grid in the lower part of the query definition form.

name.text: q040 By default, for queries of two or more tables, Microsoft Access shows only

questiontext.text: By default, for queries of two or more tables, Microsoft Access shows only those rows that have value matches in both tables.

name.text: q041 Leonard, a librarian, needs to create a report using data from a table that

questiontext.text: Leonard, a librarian, needs to create a report using data from a table that lists books on management studies and another that lists books on law. Which of the following tools will help Leonard create his report?

name.text: q042 Which of the following tabs in Microsoft Access is used to generate reports

questiontext.text: Which of the following tabs in Microsoft Access is used to generate reports?

name.text: q043 Which of the following statements is TRUE of reports in Microsoft Access?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of reports in Microsoft Access?

answer.text: Reports can be created by using the sections in the Database Tools tab.
The Report Wizard is required when data from more than one table is to be used.
Only the primary key's column width can be increased in a report.
A report cannot be used to present the sum or average of values stored in a database.

name.text: q044 To create a report in Microsoft Access with data from a single table, we mu

questiontext.text: To create a report in Microsoft Access with data from a single table, we must use the Report Wizard.

name.text: q045 In Microsoft Access, a report is created using a process similar to that fo

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, a report is created using a process similar to that for forms.

name.text: q046 The option to create reports can be found in the Database Tools tab of Micr

questiontext.text: The option to create reports can be found in the Database Tools tab of Microsoft Access.

name.text: q047 In Microsoft Access reports, the Grouping & Totals section contains the opt

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access reports, the Grouping & Totals section contains the options to display totals in a report.

name.text: q048 How can a user generate reports in Microsoft Access?

questiontext.text: How can a user generate reports in Microsoft Access?

graderinfo.text: Users can create a report using a process similar to that for forms, but the report won't include data from more than one table. Report Wizard is used to create a report with data from two or more tables. Click the Create tab, and then in the Reports section click Report Wizard. Now, select the tables in the Table/Queries combo box, highlight the field in the Available Fields list, and click the single chevron (>) to add the selected field to the report. Using a similar process, other fields can be added, even from other tables. On clicking Finish, the report is generated.

name.text: q049 How can one identify a primary key in a data model?

questiontext.text: How can one identify a primary key in a data model?

answer.text: It has the title 'primary key' next to it.

name.text: q050 A table should have multiple primary keys.

questiontext.text: A table should have multiple primary keys.

name.text: q051 In Access, what is the next step after the tables are created?

questiontext.text: In Access, what is the next step after the tables are created?

answer.text: The connection is made between all keys.

name.text: q052 In Access, there are several ways to create a data entry form.

questiontext.text: In Access, there are several ways to create a data entry form.

name.text: q053 It is difficult to make a data entry form more pleasing and easier to use.

questiontext.text: It is difficult to make a data entry form more pleasing and easier to use.

name.text: q054 Access does not remember relationships between tables.

questiontext.text: Access does not remember relationships between tables.

name.text: q055 How does one run in query in Access?

questiontext.text: How does one run in query in Access?

name.text: q056 Kathy wants to show a summary of all of the sales for the region at the bot

questiontext.text: Kathy wants to show a summary of all of the sales for the region at the bottom of the report. How does she get started?

answer.text: In Design View, Click Group & Sort, then Grouping & Totals.
Under tools, click the Group & Sort button.
Summaries can only be created with queries.

name.text: q057 When you create a database, you have to save your database in the default d

questiontext.text: When you create a database, you have to save your database in the default directory.

name.text: q058 What is the next step after the tables are created when creating a database

questiontext.text: What is the next step after the tables are created when creating a database.

name.text: q059 Access provides options for customizing and organizing data entry forms.

questiontext.text: Access provides options for customizing and organizing data entry forms.

name.text: q060 Queries are not useful in Access.

questiontext.text: Queries are not useful in Access.

category.text: $course$/Experiencing MIS, 9e (Kroenke)/020 Chapter Extension 8 Using Excel and Access Together

name.text: q001 A user can readily create data entry forms, queries, and sophisticated and

questiontext.text: A user can readily create data entry forms, queries, and sophisticated and professional reports with the help of ________.

name.text: q002 Debbie works for an automobile manufacturing plant. Her job profile compris

questiontext.text: Debbie works for an automobile manufacturing plant. Her job profile comprises tracking orders, inventory, and equipment. Which of the following is best suited to assist Debbie with her duties?

name.text: q003 Which of the following is an advantage of Microsoft Excel over Microsoft Ac

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an advantage of Microsoft Excel over Microsoft Access?

answer.text: Microsoft Excel is superior for tracking orders, inventory, and equipment.
Microsoft Excel is superior for tracking people, such as employees and customers.
Microsoft Excel is superb at processing interrelated formulas and creating stylish graphics.
Microsoft Excel is better at creating data entry forms, queries, and professional reports.

name.text: q004 Microsoft Access is a database management system.

questiontext.text: Microsoft Access is a database management system.

name.text: q005 Microsoft Excel is superior to Microsoft Access for tracking orders, invent

questiontext.text: Microsoft Excel is superior to Microsoft Access for tracking orders, inventory, equipment, and people.

name.text: q006 To use Microsoft Excel to process data stored in Microsoft Access, it is re

questiontext.text: To use Microsoft Excel to process data stored in Microsoft Access, it is recommended to rekey all of the Access data into Excel.

name.text: q007 Explain the significance of using Microsoft Access and Microsoft Excel toge

questiontext.text: Explain the significance of using Microsoft Access and Microsoft Excel together.

graderinfo.text: Microsoft Excel is good at processing interrelated formulas. Due to this feature, business users often select Excel for processing financial statements, creating budgets, and performing financial analyses. Excel can be used to create sophisticated and stylish graphics with very little work from the user. Microsoft Access is a database management system (DBMS), and the primary purpose of a DBMS is to keep track of things. Access is superior for tracking orders, inventory, equipment, people, and so forth. Users can readily create data entry forms, queries, and sophisticated and professional reports with Access. So, it is often necessary to use Excel to process data stored in Access and vice versa. For example, Excel can be used to create graphs of Access data and Access can be used to summarize Excel data and produce sophisticated reports.

name.text: q008 Peter requires data from the company's database to create a report on the a

questiontext.text: Peter requires data from the company's database to create a report on the attrition rate for the year. He transfers the required numbers from the database onto an Excel sheet where he can tabulate them. This process is an example of ________.

name.text: q009 Which of the following statements is TRUE of delimited files?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of delimited files?

answer.text: Microsoft Access can import only tab-delimited files.
Delimited files cannot be imported by Microsoft Excel.
A comma-delimited file has data that contains commas.
Field values in a tab-delimited file are separated by tabs.

name.text: q010 Which of the following is TRUE about the import/export of data from Microso

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE about the import/export of data from Microsoft Access to Microsoft Excel?

answer.text: Data can only be transferred by exporting the data into a text file and then importing that text data.
Delimited text files cannot be imported into both Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access.
The import/export process in both Microsoft Access to Microsoft Excel maintains an active connection to the source of the data.
Data must be reimported to Microsoft Excel in order to remain up-to-date if the source data in Microsoft Access is modified.

name.text: q011 Delimited text files can be imported to Microsoft Access by selecting the _

questiontext.text: Delimited text files can be imported to Microsoft Access by selecting the ________ tab.

name.text: q012 Roy is in charge of logistics at a courier company. He inputs data into the

questiontext.text: Roy is in charge of logistics at a courier company. He inputs data into the company's database and imports it from there onto an Excel sheet whenever required. Given that he transfers the data using text files, which of the following sequence of steps is he most likely to follow to import the data?

answer.text: Insert tab → Get External Data → From Access
Edit tab → Get External Data → From Access
File tab → Get External Data → From Text
External Data tab → New Data Source → Text File

name.text: q013 Import/export is the process of transferring data from one computer system

questiontext.text: Import/export is the process of transferring data from one computer system to another.

name.text: q014 In Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access, import/export maintains an active

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access, import/export maintains an active connection to the source of the data.

name.text: q015 If users change the Microsoft Access data, the imported data in Microsoft E

questiontext.text: If users change the Microsoft Access data, the imported data in Microsoft Excel will be out-of-date until it is reimported.

name.text: q016 While saving data in text files, commas cannot be used to separate field da

questiontext.text: While saving data in text files, commas cannot be used to separate field data if the data itself contains commas.

name.text: q017 Delimited text files cannot be imported into either Microsoft Excel or Micr

questiontext.text: Delimited text files cannot be imported into either Microsoft Excel or Microsoft Access.

name.text: q018 To import data into Microsoft Excel, open Excel, click the Data tab, and in

questiontext.text: To import data into Microsoft Excel, open Excel, click the Data tab, and in the Get External Data section of that ribbon, click From Text.

name.text: q019 Data can be exchanged between Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access by expor

questiontext.text: Data can be exchanged between Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access by exporting the data into a text file and then importing that text data.

name.text: q020 To exchange data between Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access, the data mus

questiontext.text: To exchange data between Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access, the data must be imported into a text file and then exported.

name.text: q021 What is import/export of data? Why is it necessary to refresh the import/ex

questiontext.text: What is import/export of data? Why is it necessary to refresh the import/export data in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access on a timely basis?

graderinfo.text: Import/export is the process of transferring data from one computer system to another. In almost all cases, including Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access, import/export does not maintain an active connection to the source of the data. If users subsequently change the Access data, the imported data in Excel will be out of date until the users reimport it. As the imported data can become outdated, users should develop procedures (either manual or automated) to ensure that data are refreshed on a timely basis.

name.text: q022 What are delimited text files?

questiontext.text: What are delimited text files?

graderinfo.text: Delimited text files are files that have field values separated by common symbols known as delimiters. The files that use commas as delimiters are known as comma-delimited files. Sometimes, however, the data itself contains commas, and so commas cannot be used to separate field data. In that case, some other character is used to delimit the fields. The tab character is frequently used, in such cases; the export file is called a tab-delimited file. Delimited text files are easy to import into either Microsoft Excel or Microsoft Access.

name.text: q023 Joan works for Human Resources at a content development firm. She recruits

questiontext.text: Joan works for Human Resources at a content development firm. She recruits candidates from multiple fields of study. As a result, the firm is a pool of talent from different disciplines. To depict this diversity, Joan wants to calculate the percentage of employees in each discipline and represent the number on a pie chart using Excel. Which of the following sequence of steps should Joan follow to create her chart?

answer.text: Add → Charts → Pie
Insert → Illustrations → Pie
Diagrams → Illustrations → Pie
Insert → Charts → Pie

name.text: q024 Matthew, the head of the sales department, has noticed a significant declin

questiontext.text: Matthew, the head of the sales department, has noticed a significant decline in performance in one of his sales teams over the years. He wants to compare the team's performance data over the last five years to study the exact decline percentage. Which of the following Microsoft Excel diagrams should Matthew use for this purpose?

name.text: q025 Which of the following tabs in Microsoft Excel contains the option to creat

questiontext.text: Which of the following tabs in Microsoft Excel contains the option to create a column chart?

name.text: q026 Which of the following shows the correct sequence of steps for creating a c

questiontext.text: Which of the following shows the correct sequence of steps for creating a column chart in Microsoft Excel?

answer.text: Diagrams → Illustrations → Column
Add-Ins → Charts → Column
Insert → Illustrations → Column
Insert → Charts → Column

name.text: q027 Microsoft Excel includes comprehensive tools for graphing data.

questiontext.text: Microsoft Excel includes comprehensive tools for graphing data.

name.text: q028 A pie chart can be created by selecting the Charts option from the Data tab

questiontext.text: A pie chart can be created by selecting the Charts option from the Data tab in Microsoft Excel.

name.text: q029 A pie chart can be used to compare results of various data for two years or

questiontext.text: A pie chart can be used to compare results of various data for two years or more.

name.text: q030 If a user clicks on a graph in Microsoft Excel, it will show a special tab

questiontext.text: If a user clicks on a graph in Microsoft Excel, it will show a special tab called Chart Tools that can be used to customize the graph.

name.text: q031 To create a column chart, the data is highlighted and the Column option in

questiontext.text: To create a column chart, the data is highlighted and the Column option in the Charts section of the Insert tab is selected.

name.text: q032 Explain the procedure for creating graphs in Microsoft Excel.

questiontext.text: Explain the procedure for creating graphs in Microsoft Excel.

graderinfo.text:
Microsoft Excel includes comprehensive tools for graphing data. It can be used to construct column and bar charts, pie charts, line and scatter plots, and others graphs. Graphs can be created by clicking the Insert tab in the ribbon, selecting the Charts section of that ribbon, and selecting the required graph from the dropdowns.
For example, to create a pie chart, we must highlight the cells that have the required data, click the Insert tab in the ribbon, and in the Charts section of that ribbon select the Pie icon. Excel can create several different versions of pie charts.
Excel provides many different tools to customize a graph. To access them, click the graph you want to change. Excel will show a special tab called Chart Tools at the top of the window. Click Chart Tools to make them available.

name.text: q033 In Microsoft Access, the Totals button is present in the ________ section o

questiontext.text: In Microsoft Access, the Totals button is present in the ________ section of the Design tab.

name.text: q034 An organization stores the details of its employees using Microsoft Access.

questiontext.text: An organization stores the details of its employees using Microsoft Access. The Employee table has EmployeeName, EmployeeID, Department, and Salary columns. Which of the following statements is TRUE?

answer.text: To view the average salary drawn by the employees of each department, the Group By option should be selected in the Total row under Salary.
To count the number of employees in each department, the Group By option should be selected under EmployeeID, and the Count option under Department.
To find the sum of salaries drawn by the employees of each department, the Group By option should be selected under Department and Sum under Salary.
To count the number of employees having the same salary, the Group By option should be selected under EmployeeID, and Count under Salary.

name.text: q035 A school stores attendance records of its students in a Microsoft Access da

questiontext.text: A school stores attendance records of its students in a Microsoft Access database. The Attendance table has StudentName, StudentID, Grade, and DateAbsent columns. Each time a student is absent, an entry is made into the database. Which of the following statements is TRUE?

answer.text: To find the average number of days students of each grade are absent, Group By should be selected under Grade and Avg under StudentID.
To find the number of days each student is absent, Group By should be selected for StudentID, and Count for DateAbsent.
To see which students were absent on a particular day, Group By should be selected for StudentName.
To see the number of students absent in a particular grade on a given day, Group By should be selected for both DateAbsent and StudentID.

name.text: q036 Which of the following statements is TRUE of queries?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of queries?

answer.text: In Microsoft Access, a query can be based on the results of other queries that have been saved.
To inform Microsoft Access that the fields of two tables are the same, select the Group By option for both fields.
The Group By option becomes available when Append is clicked under the Design tab.
When the results of a query are imported by Microsoft Excel, they cannot be operated on.

name.text: q037 The Totals button is present in the Results section of the Design tab.

questiontext.text: The Totals button is present in the Results section of the Design tab.

name.text: q038 The Average function and Group By cannot be used in the same query.

questiontext.text: The Average function and Group By cannot be used in the same query.

name.text: q039 How are group totals created in Microsoft Access?

questiontext.text: How are group totals created in Microsoft Access?

graderinfo.text: Open the relevant database, click the Create tab, click Query Design, and then select a table for the query. After adding a table, click Close. Now add the fields to the query contents table by double-clicking on them in the table diagram. Click the Totals button in the Show/Hide section of the Design tab. In response, Microsoft Access adds a row labeled Total to the query contents table. To group the rows by a particular field, select the keyword Group By in the Total row under that field in the query contents table. To find the total of a field, select the keyword Sum under the appropriate column. Run the query by clicking the large exclamation point in the Results section of the Design ribbon.

name.text: q040 How can Microsoft Excel be used to graph Microsoft Access data?

questiontext.text: How can Microsoft Excel be used to graph Microsoft Access data?

graderinfo.text:
Microsoft Access data, including queries, can be imported to Microsoft Excel to display the results with the help of Excel's graphing capabilities. To import data into Excel, open Excel, click the Data tab in the ribbon and then, in the Get External Data section, select From Access option. Excel will query Access to determine the tables and queries that exist in the chosen database.
Next, Excel will ask the user on how the data should be displayed. Choose Table and Existing worksheet, and enter an absolute address for the top, left-hand corner of the table. Use the displayed data to create graphs in Excel.

name.text: q041 Which of the following shows the correct sequence of steps for formatting c

questiontext.text: Which of the following shows the correct sequence of steps for formatting currency values in Microsoft Excel?

answer.text: Home → Number → Currency
Data → Number → Currency
Home → Editing → Currency
Data → Editing → Currency

name.text: q042 Microsoft Access queries can be imported into Microsoft Excel.

questiontext.text: Microsoft Access queries can be imported into Microsoft Excel.

name.text: q043 Importing data from Microsoft Access to Microsoft Excel is easily achieved

questiontext.text: Importing data from Microsoft Access to Microsoft Excel is easily achieved by clicking the Data tab and directing Excel to get the external data from Access.

name.text: q044 A ________, which is a subset of the cells in a worksheet that has a unique

questiontext.text: A ________, which is a subset of the cells in a worksheet that has a unique name, enables data to be transferred from Microsoft Excel to Microsoft Access.

name.text: q045 Which of the following procedures must be used to create a named range for

questiontext.text: Which of the following procedures must be used to create a named range for data in Microsoft Excel?

answer.text: highlight the required data → click the Formulas tab → click Define Name in the Defined Names section → enter a suitable name
highlight the required data → click the Home tab → click Insert Name in the Cells section → enter a suitable name
highlight the required data → click the Data tab → click Connections in the Connections section →? enter a suitable name
highlight the required data → click the Design tab → click Property Sheet in the Show/Hide section → enter a suitable name

name.text: q001 A personal area network ________.

questiontext.text: A personal area network ________.

answer.text: is a wireless connection that connects devices belonging to two different people
connects devices that are located around a single person
has a minimum range of five miles
is defined as a network of networks

name.text: q002 The distinguishing characteristic of a local area network (LAN) is that it

questiontext.text: The distinguishing characteristic of a local area network (LAN) is that it ________.

answer.text: connects computers at a single location
does not require a wired connection

name.text: q003 A(n) ________ connects computers at different geographical locations.

name.text: q007 With a wide area network (WAN), an organization can place communications li

questiontext.text: With a wide area network (WAN), an organization can place communications lines wherever it wants because all lines reside on its premises.

name.text: q008 An internet is a network of networks that connects local area networks (LAN

questiontext.text: An internet is a network of networks that connects local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), and other internets.

name.text: q009 A private internet that is used exclusively within an organization is calle

questiontext.text: A private internet that is used exclusively within an organization is called a personal area network.

name.text: q010 A private internet that is used exclusively within an organization is calle

questiontext.text: A private internet that is used exclusively within an organization is called an intranet.

name.text: q011 What is the difference between a local area network (LAN) and a wide area n

questiontext.text: What is the difference between a local area network (LAN) and a wide area network (WAN)? Give an example of how each one could be used in businesses.

graderinfo.text: A local area network (LAN) connects computers that reside in a single geographic location on the premises of the company that operates the LAN. Wide area networks (WANs) connect computers at different geographic locations. The computers in two separated company sites must be connected using a WAN. With a LAN, the number of connected computers can range from two to several hundred, but they are still in a single location (usually within a building or floor of a building). Most small businesses have a LAN in their office that connects them. A university campus connects all the different buildings on the campus and possibly multiple campuses via a WAN.

name.text: q012 A ________ is a networking device that detects the speed that a given devic

questiontext.text: A ________ is a networking device that detects the speed that a given device on a local area network (LAN) can handle and communicates with it at that speed.

the distance over which the network signal can be transmitted
the rate at which data can be transmitted
the Internet protocol used by a system

name.text: q020 Which of the following statements is TRUE of an Internet service provider (

answer.text: It separates the phone signals from computer signals on a digital subscriber line (DSL) at a user's location.
It facilitates a one-way information transfer process between a user's computer and the Internet.
It allows a user to communicate directly through the Internet without requiring a wireless medium of communication.
It provides a legitimate Internet address and serves as a user's gateway to the Internet.

name.text: q021 Which of the following statements is TRUE of digital subscriber lines (DSLs

answer.text: They use television lines for data transmission.
Their signals do not interfere with voice telephone services.
Their operations are independent of voice telephone lines.

Cable lines use the same protocols used by data transmission lines.
The signals from cable lines do not interfere with TV signals.

name.text: q028 Wireless mice use Bluetooth to connect to a computer.

questiontext.text: Wireless mice use Bluetooth to connect to a computer.

name.text: q029 Bluetooth is a protocol that can transmit data over long distances.

questiontext.text: Bluetooth is a protocol that can transmit data over long distances.

name.text: q030 A digital subscriber line (DSL) operates on the same lines as voice telepho

questiontext.text: A digital subscriber line (DSL) operates on the same lines as voice telephones.

name.text: q031 Cable lines provide high-speed data transmission using phone lines.

questiontext.text: Cable lines provide high-speed data transmission using phone lines.

name.text: q032 What is Bluetooth? What are its uses?

questiontext.text: What is Bluetooth? What are its uses?

graderinfo.text: Bluetooth is a common wireless protocol used to make personal area network (PAN) connections. It is designed for transmitting data over short distances, replacing cables. Devices, such as wireless mice, keyboards, printers, and headphones, use Bluetooth to connect to desktop computers. Other devices like smartwatches and fitness trackers can use Bluetooth to connect smartphones and send data over the Internet. More and more devices like clothing, automobiles, and sports equipment are becoming Bluetooth enabled.

name.text: q033 What are the three important functions of an Internet service provider (ISP

questiontext.text: What are the three important functions of an Internet service provider (ISP)?

graderinfo.text: An ISP has three important functions. First, it provides the client with a legitimate Internet address. Second, it serves as a gateway to the Internet. The ISP receives the communications from a client's computer and passes them on to the Internet, and it receives communications from the Internet and passes them on to the client. Finally, ISPs pay for the Internet. They collect money from their customers and pay access fees and other charges on their behalf.

name.text: q034 Which of the following statements defines an IP address?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements defines an IP address?

answer.text: It is a protocol that specifies the format of Web pages.
It is a number that identifies a particular device.
It is a piece of message handled by programs that implement Internet protocol.
It is a program that breaks up network traffic into pieces before transmission.

name.text: q035 Which of the following statements is TRUE of an IP address?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of an IP address?

answer.text: The use of an IP address is limited to the public Internet.
An IP address can be associated with just one domain name.
The IP address that a domain name points to can be changed.
An IP address commonly has either a three-decimal or five-decimal dotted notation.

name.text: q036 A ________ is a worldwide-unique identity that is affiliated with a public

questiontext.text: A ________ is a worldwide-unique identity that is affiliated with a public IP address.

name.text: q037 Samantha is browsing through some geological sites to collect information f

name.text: q038 Which of the following is a component of the user tier?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a component of the user tier?

answer.text: a computer that has browsers that request and process Web pages
a computer that runs Web servers and processes application programs
a computer that runs a database management system (DBMS) that processes requests for data from a commerce server
a computer that receives Web page requests and sends them to an available server to minimize customer delays in a facility called a Web farm

name.text: q039 Which of the following is the second tier in the three-tier architecture ar

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the second tier in the three-tier architecture arrangement?

name.text: q040 ________ are programs that run on a server-tier computer and manage traffic

questiontext.text: ________ are programs that run on a server-tier computer and manage traffic by sending and receiving Web pages to and from clients.

name.text: q041 Which of the following statements is TRUE of Web servers?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of Web servers?

answer.text: They typically perform the functions of tracking and managing the products in a database.
They are part of the user tier in the three-tier architecture.
They are used only to send and receive Webmail.
They send and receive Web pages to and from clients.

name.text: q042 The movement from one network to another is called a hop.

questiontext.text: The movement from one network to another is called a hop.

name.text: q043 The user tier consists of computers, phones, and other devices.

questiontext.text: The user tier consists of computers, phones, and other devices.

name.text: q044 The server tier consists of computers that run a database management system

questiontext.text: The server tier consists of computers that run a database management system (DBMS) that processes requests to retrieve and store data.

name.text: q045 What is the TCP/IP Protocol architecture? Where are the various application

questiontext.text: What is the TCP/IP Protocol architecture? Where are the various application-layer protocols?

graderinfo.text:
The protocols used on the Internet are arranged according to a structure known as the TCP/IP Protocol architecture. This architecture has five layers, and one or more protocols are defined at each layer. Data communications and software vendors write computer programs that implement the rules of a particular protocol. For protocols at the bottom layer, the physical layer, they build hardware devices that implement the protocol.
The top layer, or the application layer, concerns protocols used between browsers and Web servers. Hypertext Transport Protocol (http), Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (smtp), and File Transfer Protocol (ftp) are application-layer protocols.

name.text: q046 What is HTTP? How does it work?

questiontext.text: What is HTTP? How does it work?

graderinfo.text: Hypertext Transport Protocol (http) is an application layer protocol. It is used between browsers and Web servers. Browsers send and receive service requests to and from the commerce server using http. This allows browsers and servers who implement http to communicate with each other. The browsers send and receive service requests to and from a server using http.

name.text: q047 Differentiate between private and public Internet protocol (IP) addresses.

questiontext.text: Differentiate between private and public Internet protocol (IP) addresses. Explain the benefits of the private/public IP address scheme.

graderinfo.text:
Public IP addresses identify a particular device on the public Internet. Because public IP addresses must be unique worldwide, their assignment is controlled by a public agency known as Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN). Private IP addresses identify a particular device on a private network, usually on a local area network (LAN). Their assignment is controlled within the LAN, usually by the LAN device.
The private/public IP address scheme has two major benefits. First, public IP addresses are conserved. All of the computers on the LAN use only one public IP address. Second, by using private IP addresses, users are protected from attackers directly attacking them because attackers cannot send attack packets to private IP addresses. Attackers can only send packets to devices with public IP addresses.

name.text: q048 What is a domain name? What is the procedure to get a domain name?

questiontext.text: What is a domain name? What is the procedure to get a domain name?

graderinfo.text: A domain name is a worldwide-unique name that is affiliated with a public IP address. When an organization or individual wants to register a domain name, it goes to a company that applies to an ICANN (Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers) approved agency to do so. The company will first determine if the desired name is unique, worldwide. If so, it will apply to register that name to the applicant. Once the registration is completed, the applicant can affiliate a public IP address with the domain name. From that point onward, traffic for the new domain name will be routed to the affiliated IP address.

name.text: q049 What are the different tiers in the three-tier architecture used by Web app

questiontext.text: What are the different tiers in the three-tier architecture used by Web applications?

graderinfo.text: Almost all web applications use the three-tier architecture, which is an arrangement of user computers and servers into three categories, or tiers. The user tier consists of computers, phones, and other devices that have browsers that request and process Web pages. The server tier consists of computers that run Web servers and process application programs. The database tier consists of computers that run a database management system (DBMS) that processes requests to retrieve and store data.

name.text: q050 How does a Web server differ from a commerce server?

questiontext.text: How does a Web server differ from a commerce server?

graderinfo.text: Web servers are programs that run on a server-tier computer and manage traffic by sending and receiving Web pages to and from clients. A commerce server is an application program that runs on a server-tier computer. Typical commerce server functions are to obtain product data from a database, manage the items in a shopping cart, and coordinate the checkout process. When a request comes to the server, the Web server examines it and sends it to the proper program for processing. Thus, the Web server passes e-commerce traffic to the commerce server. It passes requests for other applications to those applications.

name.text: q051 Which of the following statements is TRUE of service-oriented architecture

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of service-oriented architecture (SOA)?

answer.text: Work is assigned to Web servers based on their geographical proximity to a user.
SOA services are used only between the Web server and the users.
The number of database servers and Web servers should be in a fixed ratio.
JavaScript is written to invoke services defined by a server application.

name.text: q052 Which of the following purposes does a Hypertext Transport Protocol (http)

questiontext.text: Which of the following purposes does a Hypertext Transport Protocol (http) serve?

answer.text: determining the IP address of devices on a network
providing a reliable network for data communication
enabling communication between a browser and server

It cannot be used to support Web services.
